intro: Lagascea tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly lagascea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage, which provides insulation and helps it survive in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with ray florets that resemble petals. Lagascea tomentosa is often found in rocky soils and dry slopes, thriving in full sun.
